text: The 1976 Republican presidential primaries were how voters of the Republican Party chose its nominee for President of the United States in the 1976 U.S. presidential election. Current President Gerald Ford was selected as the nominee through a series of primary elections and caucuses which was held in the 1976 Republican National Convention. It was held from August 16 to August 19, 1976 in Kansas City, Missouri. The 1976 primary was the first Republican primary to hold primaries in every state, the Democrats held the first nationwide primary in 1972. ==Nominees== Image:Gerald Ford.jpg|President Gerald Ford of Michigan Image:Ronald Reagan 1981 presidential portrait.jpg|Former Governor Ronald Reagan of California Image:Spiro Agnew.jpg|Former Vice President Spiro Agnew of Maryland Image:Howard Baker photo.jpg|Senator Howard Baker of Tennessee File:Edward Brooke.jpg|Senator Edward Brooke of Massachusetts Image:JamesLBuckley.jpg|Senator James Buckley of New York File:Daniel J.
